channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: With just days left until funding deadline, lawmakers seem no closer to making a deal
item.description: A contentious House hearing with senior immigration leaders did little to bring lawmakers closer on a deal to fund the Department of Homeland Security.
item.content:encoded: A contentious House hearing with senior immigration leaders did little to bring lawmakers closer on a deal to fund the Department of Homeland Security.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Rep. Mike Quigley, D-Ill., talks about ICE reforms ahead of DHS funding deadline
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Democratic Rep. Mike Quigley of Illinois about DHS funding and ICE reforms ahead of Friday's deadline to avert a partial government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Democratic Rep. Mike Quigley of Illinois about DHS funding and ICE reforms ahead of Friday's deadline to avert a partial government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trump administration removes Pride flag from Stonewall National Monument
item.description: The National Park Service took down a Pride flag from the Stonewall National Monument in New York City, a landmark of the LGBTQ rights movement.
item.content:encoded: The National Park Service took down a Pride flag from the Stonewall National Monument in New York City, a landmark of the LGBTQ rights movement.
item.dc:creator: Steve Kastenbaum

item.title: The U.S. claims China is conducting secret nuclear tests. Here's what that means
item.description: The allegations were leveled by U.S. officials late last week. Arms control experts worry that norms against nuclear testing are unraveling.
item.content:encoded:
The allegations were leveled by U.S. officials late last week. Arms control experts worry that norms against nuclear testing are unraveling.

(Image credit: GREG BAKER)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: A person was briefly detained in connection with Nancy Guthrie's disappearance, Israeli prime minister to meet with Trump, lawmakers appear divided on ICE reforms as funding deadline approaches.
item.content:encoded: A person was briefly detained in connection with Nancy Guthrie's disappearance, Israeli prime minister to meet with Trump, lawmakers appear divided on ICE reforms as funding deadline approaches.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: 'I feel hope': Venezuelan opposition leader talks about being released from detention
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Jesús Armas, a prominent Venezuelan opposition leader, who was – until recently – held at one of Latin America's most notorious detention centers.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Jesús Armas, a prominent Venezuelan opposition leader, who was – until recently – held at one of Latin America's most notorious detention centers.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick testifies about visiting Jeffrey Epstein's island
item.description: A former Florida police chief said he spoke with Donald Trump in the mid-2000s about Jeffrey Epstein's behavior, and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick testified about visiting Epstein's island.
item.content:encoded: A former Florida police chief said he spoke with Donald Trump in the mid-2000s about Jeffrey Epstein's behavior, and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick testified about visiting Epstein's island.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Michigan governor says bridge project is moving forward despite Trump's threat
item.description: A day after President Trump threatened to block the opening of a bridge between Michigan and Canada, the state's governor says the project will proceed as planned.
item.content:encoded: A day after President Trump threatened to block the opening of a bridge between Michigan and Canada, the state's governor says the project will proceed as planned.
item.dc:creator: Colin Jackson

item.title: Auditions for 'Handmaid's Tale' opera draw more than 1,000 hopefuls
item.description: More than a thousand people signed up for auditions in hopes of becoming an extra in the upcoming opera of "The Handmaid's Tale" in Detroit.
item.content:encoded: More than a thousand people signed up for auditions in hopes of becoming an extra in the upcoming opera of "The Handmaid's Tale" in Detroit.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore talks about being excluded from White House governors event
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Maryland's Democratic Gov. Wes Moore about being disinvited from a White House event and his support for redistricting in his state.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Maryland's Democratic Gov. Wes Moore about being disinvited from a White House event and his support for redistricting in his state.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin
